Unable to write to recovery partition. Select an image file and flash it instead.

Tipatch was unable to find your device\'s recovery partition. Select an image file and flash it instead.
Please select an image file to patch.
Where to save the patched recovery image
Patch the current recovery in-place (requires root)
Back up the current recovery before patching (recommended)

What is Tipatch?

Tipatch patches TWRP recovery to back up your internal storage (emulated SD card), meaning your photos, music, game data, downloads, and more will be saved in backups instead of excluded.

How do I use Tipatch?

If your device is rooted, you can patch your current recovery (both slots on A/B) with one tap.

If you\'re not rooted, download your device\'s recovery image and patch that. Then flash or boot the patched image as usual.

Effects

    • \"Data (incl. storage)\" on Backup screen
    • \"Backups of Data include…\" while backing up
    • Bigger Data size on Backup screen

Side effect: Wiping Data will also wipe internal storage.

If you use a theme or a language other than English, the text will not change. Revert to the default theme and/or change to English to confirm.

Restoring backups with internal storage does not require a patched recovery.

Problems?

If Tipatch does not work properly on your device in any way, please let me know via the Contact menu option.

Help, something broke!

Reflash your recovery image. If you used in-place patching, tap \'Restore backup\' in the action menu.
